A cosmetologist examination shall consist of a theoretical portion and a pr
Sanitation and disinfection;
Chemical applications;
Hair cutting and styling techniques;
Diseases and disorders;
Facial massage;
Skin care;
Makeup application;
Hair removal;
Application of artificial nails;
Manicuring and pedicuring procedures; and
Laws and regulations regarding the practice of cosmetology.
The theoretical portion of the cosmetologist examination shall consist of q
Wet set or thermal curl set;
Permanent cold wave;
Chemical relaxing;
Hair pressing;
Croquignole curl;
Bleach and tint;
Blended haircut;
Fingerwave;
Pincurls;
Roller placement; and
Manicure.
The practical portion of the cosmetologist examination shall consist of the
Content of Cosmetologist Examination.

Diseases and disorders; and
Laws and regulations regarding the practice of cosmetology.

An esthetician examination shall consist of a theoretical portion and a pra
Sanitation and disinfection;
Diseases and disorders;
Facial massage;
Skin care;
Makeup application;
Hair removal; and
Laws and regulations regarding the practice of esthetics.
The theoretical portion of the esthetician examination shall consist of que
Patron preparation;
Skin cleansing;
Skin analysis;
Location and names of motor points;
Tweezing and arching of eyebrows;
Massage movements; and
Application of women's daytime makeup.
The practical portion of the esthetician examination shall consist of the c
Content of Esthetician Examination.
A nail technician examination shall consist of a theoretical portion and a
Sanitation and disinfection;
Diseases and disorders;
Manicuring and pedicuring procedures;
Application of artificial nails; and
Laws and regulations regarding the practice of a nail technician.
The theoretical portion of the nail technician examination shall consist of
Basic manicure;
Hairline tip of a free edge;
Half moon;
Application of acrylic nails; and
Pedicure procedure.
The practical portion of the nail technician examination shall consist of t
Contents of Nail Technician Examination.

Curling hair;
Dressing hair;
Blow drying hair;

Beautifying hair.

Purpose. This regulation is intended to carry out the provisions of Busines
In this regulation, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
“Barbers Board” means the State Board of Barbers.
“Cosmetologists Board” means the State Board of Cosmetologists.
“License fee” means the fee paid by an applicant or licensee, as applicable
“Salon owner permit fee” means the fee paid by an applicant or licensee, as
“Secretary” means the Secretary of Labor.
Terms Defined.

Nail technician — $28;
Hair stylist — $28;
Apprentice — $11;

Pre-opening inspection — $169.

A separate payment is required for each application.
Payment in cash may not be accepted.
All fees are nonrefundable.

All per diem employees are entitled to be reimbursed for traveling expenses

Operating without a valid license — $300;
No photo on license — $100;
No valid government-issued photo identification — $100;
Services beyond scope — $300;
Licensing:
Failure to wash implements before disinfection — $150;

Poor lighting, heating, or ventilation — $50;
Unclean walls, curtains, or floor coverings — $50;
Absence of hot or cold running water — $50;
Presence of rodents or insects — $50;
Use of salon (shop) for sleeping or living — $100;

Unsanitary restroom — $50;
No soap dispenser and disposable towels — $50;

Improper storage or disposal of towels — $50;
Improper sanitation of pressing combs or curling irons — $100;
Insufficient number of combs or brushes — $50;
Failure to use protective neck strip — $50;
Improperly washed or sanitized shampoo bowl — $50;
Improper cleansing or sanitation of retention rods — $100;

Failure to discard disposable implement or cosmetic after use — $100;

Improper use of electric files, bits, or sanding bands — $100;
Improper procedures when working on acrylic nails — $100;

Glycolic acid — formal hearing;
Chemical peels — formal hearing;
Practice causing tissue destruction or penetration to the blood fluid barri
Credo blade — $300;
Unauthorized services:
Services on client with infectious or contagious disease — formal hearing;

Services on inflamed skin or scalp without physician authorization — formal
Removal of corns, calluses, or other growths of skin by cutting — $300;

Cosmetic tattooing — formal hearing;
Presence of an animal other than a designated service animal — $100;
Sale of used hairpieces — $300;

Interference with inspector — formal hearing.

c.t: .06 Complaints and Violations in Beauty Schools.

c.x: This regulation applies whenever a complaint is made to the Board by an ins
Upon receipt of a complaint, in compliance with Business Occupations and Pr
If the Board determines that the complaint does not allege grounds adequate
If the Board determines that the complaint does allege grounds adequate to
If the owner corrects each alleged violation within 10 days of the written
If the owner fails to correct each alleged violation within 10 days of the
If the Board conducts a hearing and concludes that the owner has violated o
The Board shall report the sanitation violation and the amount of fine impo
Failure to wash implements before disinfection — $150;
Failure to properly disinfect implements, bowls, basins, or other areas — $
Failure to properly store disinfected implements — $150;
Failure to keep clean disinfectant on esthetician tray or nail technician t
Improper disinfection:
Improper procedures for cut or blood-related incidents — formal hearing;
Poor lighting, heating, or ventilation — $50;
Unclean walls, curtains, or floor coverings — $50;
Absence of hot or cold running water — $50;
Presence of rodents or insects — $50;
Use of salon (shop) for sleeping or living — $100;
Failure to promptly remove hair or debris — $50;
Unsanitary restroom — $50;
No soap dispenser and disposable towels — $50;
Unclean operator's garments — $50;
Failure to wash hands before each client — $50;
No wet sanitizer at station — $50;
No closed drawer or cabinet for disinfected implements at station — $100;
Use of neck duster, powder puff, sponge, septic pencil, or lump alum on mor
Improper application, removal, or discarding of lotions, oils, and other li
Improper application of creams — $100;
Improper maintenance of lotions, oils, and other liquids — $100;
Failure to properly cover head, foot rest, or manicuring cushion — $100;
Improper storage or disposal of towels — $50;
Improper sanitation of pressing combs or curling irons — $100;
Insufficient number of combs or brushes — $50;
Failure to use protective neck strip — $50;
Improperly washed or sanitized shampoo bowl — $50;
Improper cleansing or sanitation of retention rods — $100;
Failure to remove soiled items from top of work station after use — $50;
Placement of pins or clips in mouth — $50;
Use of implements dropped on floor without cleaning and disinfecting — $100
Failure to sharpen lip or eyebrow pencil after each use — $100;
Failure to discard disposable implement or cosmetic after use — $100;
Use of hair removal wax for more than one client — $300;
Failure to launder nondisposable draping after each client — $50;
Unsanitary manicuring table or surrounding area — $100;
Improper paraffin wax procedures — $100;
Improper use of electric files, bits, or sanding bands — $100;
Improper procedures when working on acrylic nails — $100;
Other:
Sanitation:
Services on client with infectious or contagious disease — formal hearing;
Operator with infectious or contagious disease performing services — formal
Services on inflamed skin or scalp without physician authorization — formal
Removal of corns, calluses, or other growths of skin by cutting — $300;
Use of electrical muscle stimulator devices — $300;
Cosmetic tattooing — formal hearing;
Presence of an animal other than a designated service animal — $100;
Sale of used hairpieces — $300;
Methyl methacrylate liquid monomer (MMA) — formal hearing;
Prohibited Practices:
Interference with inspector — formal hearing.
